title: Spatial Extension from Tetrahedral-Octahedral Honeycomb

issues: MINOR: Visualization in R³ may give false impression of metric dependence
strengths: Abstract graph definition is mathematically valid and unique
Theorem honestly acknowledges irreducible axiom (A0 → A0' via Thm 0.0.16-17)
Dihedral angle uniqueness argument is mathematically rigorous
12-fold coordination matches A₂ root system structure
fcc_physical_consistency.summary: The FCC structure is physically motivated via SU(3) representation theory and dihedral angle constraints. The bootstrap critique is honestly acknowledged. The abstract graph definition is mathematically valid.

octahedra_color_neutrality.claim: Octahedral cells are color-neutral transition regions
issues: MODERATE: Physical role of octahedra needs clearer connection to QCD vacuum
strengths: Color singlet condition (1 + ω + ω² = 0) verified
Octahedron has HIGHER symmetry (O_h) than stella center (S₄)
Pressure function vanishes at octahedron center by symmetry
octahedra_color_neutrality.summary: The color neutrality of octahedral cells is algebraically verified via the color singlet condition. The higher O_h symmetry provides stronger neutrality than stella centers.

continuum_limit.claim: FCC lattice → flat Euclidean R³ with SO(3) invariance
issues: IMPORTANT: The Planck suppression of LV needs explicit derivation (claimed but not fully proven in theorem)
strengths: Anisotropy is (a/L)² suppressed at scales L >> a
FCC lattice has zero intrinsic curvature
Chirality argument for SO(3) vs O(3) is geometrically valid
continuum_limit.summary: The continuum limit argument via coarse-graining is standard physics. However, the claim that Lorentz violation is Planck-suppressed (not lattice-suppressed) needs more explicit derivation.

lattice_spacing.claim: Lattice spacing a = 0.44847 fm matches QCD confinement scale
issues: MINOR: Lattice spacing is fit, not derived in Theorem 0.0.6 itself (but is derived in supporting propositions)
strengths: E_lattice = √σ to within 1% (exact by Prop 0.0.17j derivation)
R_stella = 0.53 × r_p (reasonable for sub-hadronic scale)
E_lattice is within factor of 2 of Λ_QCD (expected for O(1) factors)
lattice_spacing.summary: The lattice spacing a = 0.44847 fm is consistent with QCD confinement scales. E_lattice = √σ exactly (derived in Prop 0.0.17j). The proton radius estimate R_stella ≈ r_p/2 is reasonable.

strengths: Wilson loop formulation is gauge-invariant and physically meaningful
Cartan algebra structure correctly gives color singlet
Color phases are 120° separated (Z₃ symmetry of SU(3) center)
Phase coherence is gauge-invariant statement (flat connection)
phase_coherence.summary: The gauge-theoretic interpretation of phase coherence is correct. Wilson loops = 1 is gauge-invariant. Phase interpolation is valid within the Cartan subalgebra where generators commute.

issues: MODERATE: Explicit derivation of Planck suppression mechanism needed (currently argued by analogy, not proven)
strengths: Lorentz violation is Planck-suppressed, consistent with observations
Consistent with lattice QCD: discrete structure doesn't imply LV
Distinguishes color-sector (visible) from photon-sector (invisible) effects
lorentz_violation_bounds.summary: The Lorentz violation bounds are correctly stated. The claim that LV is Planck-suppressed is physically reasonable and consistent with lattice QCD, but needs more explicit derivation.

framework_consistency.claim: Theorem 0.0.6 properly enables Phase 5 spacetime emergence
issues: MINOR: Forward reference to Theorem 5.2.1 creates logical ordering tension
strengths: Provides pre-geometric coordinates that break the bootstrap
Bootstrap is resolved: coordinates exist before metric
Axiom count reduced: A0 + A1 → A0' (information metric)
Derives MORE from LESS than comparable approaches

Theorem 0.0.2.description: Euclidean from SU(3) - Killing form gives metric

Theorem 0.0.3.description: Stella Uniqueness - local structure at vertices

Theorem 0.0.16.description: Adjacency from SU(3) - 12-regularity from A₂ roots

Theorem 0.2.3.description: Stable convergence point - generalized to octahedra

Theorem 5.2.1.description: Emergent metric (forward reference, enabled by this)

framework_consistency.summary: Theorem 0.0.6 is properly integrated into the framework. It resolves the bootstrap problem and enables Phase 5 spacetime emergence. The axiom reduction (A0 + A1 → A0') is a strength of the framework.
